name: Generic ABS @Tronxy X5SA
filament_start_gcode:
; Filament: ABS
; WARNING: ABS requires heated enclosure or draft-free environment
; Pressure Advance: Tune with Klipper (start ~0.045 for direct drive)
; SET_PRESSURE_ADVANCE ADVANCE=0.045
filament_end_gcode: ; ABS cool down slowly to prevent warping
filament_notes:
Generic ABS profile for Tronxy X5SA with Klipper

!! IMPORTANT - ENCLOSURE REQUIRED !!
ABS requires a heated enclosure or draft-free environment to prevent warping.
If you don't have an enclosure, consider using ABS+ or ASA instead.

Print Temperature: 250-255°C (adjust based on brand)
Bed Temperature: 100-105°C (critical for adhesion)
Chamber Temperature: 40-60°C (if available)
Cooling: MINIMAL - 0-30% max to prevent layer separation and warping

Retraction Settings (Firmware Controlled):
- Distance: 1.0mm (configured in Klipper firmware_retraction)
- Speed: 40mm/s
- Z-hop: 0.2mm
- These values shown here for reference only; actual retraction controlled by Klipper

Pressure Advance:
- Start with 0.045 for direct drive
- Fine-tune using Klipper calibration
- Add to filament_start_gcode: SET_PRESSURE_ADVANCE ADVANCE=0.045

Speed Guidelines:
- Perimeters: 50-70 mm/s
- Infill: 80-120 mm/s
- First layer: 20 mm/s (slow for maximum adhesion)
- Overhangs: 30-40 mm/s

Cooling Strategy:
- ABS warps easily with too much cooling
- Keep fan OFF for first 5 layers minimum
- Max fan speed: 30% (only for overhangs >60° or bridges)
- For large prints: consider fan completely OFF
- Small features (<10mm): may need 20-30% cooling to prevent overheating

Bed Adhesion:
- CRITICAL: Use ABS slurry, glue stick, or PEI sheet
- Clean bed with IPA before printing
- First layer: 105°C bed, 255°C nozzle for maximum adhesion
- Use brim or raft for large prints to prevent corner lifting

Warping Prevention:
- Enclosed printer strongly recommended
- Draft-free environment essential
- Maintain consistent ambient temperature
- Avoid opening enclosure during print
- Let parts cool slowly in enclosure after print completes

Ventilation:
- ABS emits styrene fumes - VENTILATION REQUIRED
- Print in well-ventilated area or use air filtration
- Do not print ABS without proper ventilation

Tips:
- First layer adhesion is everything - if it doesn't stick, stop and adjust
- Z-offset: ABS first layer should be slightly squished into bed
- Post-processing: ABS can be smoothed with acetone vapor (in ventilated area)
- Annealing: Heat parts in oven at 80°C for 2-3 hours for increased strength
- Corner lifting: increase bed temp, use brim, or reduce part cooling
